  119: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  120: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  121: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  122: 
  123: %% suite() ->
  124: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  125: 
  126: suite() ->
  127:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  128: 
  129: all() ->
  130:     [
  131:      {group, openssh},
  132:      small_interrupted_send,
  133:      interrupted_send,
  134:      manual_window_handling,
  135:      auto_window_handling,
  136:      exec_erlang_term,
  137:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  138:      exec_disabled,
  139:      exec_shell_disabled,
  140:      start_shell,
  141:      new_shell_dumb_term,
  142:      new_shell_xterm_term,
  143:      trap_exit_connect,
  144:      trap_exit_daemon,
  145:      start_shell_pty,
  146:      start_shell_exec,
  147:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  148:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  149:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  150:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  151:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  152:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  153:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data,
  154:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  155:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  156:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  157:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  158:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  159:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  160:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  161:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  162:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  163:      connect2_invalid_options,
  164:      connect_invalid_port,
  165:      connect_invalid_options,
  166:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  167:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  168:      connect3_invalid_port,
  169:      connect3_invalid_options,
  170:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  171:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  172:      connect3_invalid_both,
  173:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  174:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  175:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  176:      connect4_invalid_three,
  177:      connect_timeout,
  178:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  179:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  180:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  181:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  182:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  183:      kex_error,
  184:      stop_listener,
  185:      no_sensitive_leak,
  186:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  187:      max_channels_option
  188:     ].
  189: groups() ->
  190:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  191: 
  192: payload() ->
  193:     [simple_exec,
  194:      simple_exec_more_data,
  195:      simple_exec_sock,
  196:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  197:      small_cat,
  198:      big_cat,
  199:      send_after_exit].
  200: 
  201: ptty() ->
  202:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  203:      ptty_alloc,
  204:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  205: 
  206: sock() ->
  207:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  208:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  209:     ].
  210: 
  211: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  212: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  213:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  214:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  215:         | Config]
  216:       ).
  217: 
  218: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  219:     catch ssh:stop(),
  220:     ok.
  221: 
  222: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  223: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  224:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  225: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  226: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  227: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  228: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  229: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  230:     end;
  231: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  232:     Config.
  233: 
  234: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  235:     Config.
  236: 
  237: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  238: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  239:     io:format(user, "Testcase ~p~n", [TestCase]),
  240:     PktSize = 1024, % 1KiB
  241:     NewConfig = case TestCase of
  242:         manual_window_handling ->
  243:             [{init_win_size, 2 * PktSize}, {init_pkt_size, PktSize},
  244:              {window_handling_mode, manual},
  245:              {adjust_timeout, 2000} | Config];
  246:         auto_window_handling ->
  247:             [{init_win_size, 2 * PktSize}, {init_pkt_size, PktSize},
  248:              {window_handling_mode, auto},
  249:              {adjust_timeout, 2000} | Config];
  250:         _ -> Config
  251:     end,
  252:     ssh:stop(),
  253:     ssh:start(),
  254:     {ok, TestLogHandlerRef} = ssh_test_lib:add_log_handler(),
  255:     ssh_test_lib:verify_sanity_check(NewConfig),
  256:     [{log_handler_ref, TestLogHandlerRef} | NewConfig].
  257: 
  258: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  259:     {ok, Events} = ssh_test_lib:get_log_events(
  260:                      proplists:get_value(log_handler_ref, Config)),
  261:     EventCnt = length(Events),
  262:     {ok, InterestingEventCnt} = analyze_events(Events, EventCnt),
  263:     VerificationResult = verify_events(TestCase, InterestingEventCnt),
  264:     ssh_test_lib:rm_log_handler(),
  265:     ssh:stop(),
  266:     VerificationResult.
  267: 
  268: analyze_events(_, 0) ->
  269:     {ok, 0};
  270: analyze_events(Events, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0 ->
  271:     {ok, Cnt} = print_interesting_events(Events, 0),
  272:     case Cnt > 0 of
  273:         true ->
  274:             ct:comment("(logger stats) interesting: ~p boring: ~p",
  275:                        [Cnt, EventNumber - Cnt]);
  276:         _ ->
  277:             ct:comment("(logger stats) boring: ~p",
  278:                        [length(Events)])
  279:     end,
  280:     AllEventsSummary = lists:flatten([process_event(E) || E <- Events]),
  281:     ct:log("~nTotal logger events: ~p~nAll events:~n~s", [EventNumber, AllEventsSummary]),
  282:     {ok, Cnt}.
  283: 
  284: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  285:                         #{label := Label,
  286:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  287:                                      {Status, Properties}]}},
  288:                 level := Level}) ->
  289:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  290: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  291:                         #{label := Label,
  292:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  293:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  294:                                      {reason, {Status, _ReasonDetails}},
  295:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  296:                 level := Level}) ->
  297:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  298: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  299:                         #{label := Label,
  300:                           report := [{supervisor, Supervisor},
  301:                                      {errorContext, _ErrorContext},
  302:                                      {reason, Status},
  303:                                      {offender, Properties}]}},
  304:                 level := Level}) ->
  305:     format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level);
  306: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  307:                         #{label := Label,
  308:                           report := [Properties, []]}},
  309:                 level := Level}) ->
  310:     {status, Status} = get_value(status, Properties),
  311:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  312:     Id = get_value(registered_name, Properties),
  313:     {initial_call, {M, F, Args}} = get_value(initial_call, Properties),
  314:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s)~n",
  315:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  316:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args]]);
  317: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  318:                         #{label := Label,
  319:                           name := Pid,
  320:                           reason := {Reason, _Stack = [{M, F, Args, Location} | _]}}},
  321:                 level := Level}) ->
  322:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~30s~n",
  323:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  324:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label, Reason, undefined, M, F, Args, Location]]);
  325: process_event(#{msg := {report,
  326:                         #{label := Label,
  327:                          format := Format,
  328:                          args := Args}},
  329:                 meta := #{pid := Pid},
  330:                 level := Level}) ->
  331:     io_lib:format("[~44s]  ~6s ~30s ~150s~n",
  332:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  333:                       E <- [Pid, Level, Label]] ++ [io_lib:format(Format, Args)]);
  334: process_event(E) ->
  335:     io_lib:format("~n||RAW event||~n~p~n", [E]).
  336: 
  337: format_event1(Label, Supervisor, Status, Properties, Level) ->
  338:     {pid, Pid} = get_value(pid, Properties),
  339:     Id = get_value(id, Properties),
  340:     {M, F, Args} = get_mfa_value(Properties),
  341:     RestartType = get_value(restart_type, Properties),
  342:     Significant = get_value(significant, Properties),
  343:     io_lib:format("[~30s <- ~10s]  ~6s ~30s ~20s  ~30s ~20s:~10s(~40s) ~20s ~25s~n",
  344:                   [io_lib:format("~p", [E]) ||
  345:                       E <- [Supervisor, Pid, Level, Label, Status, Id, M, F, Args,
  346:                             Significant, RestartType]]).
  347: 
  348: get_mfa_value(Properties) ->
  349:     case get_value(mfargs, Properties) of
  350:         {mfargs, MFA} ->
  351:             MFA;
  352:         false ->
  353:             {mfa, MFA} = get_value(mfa, Properties),
  354:             MFA
  355:     end.
  356: 
  357: get_value(Key, List) ->
  358:     case lists:keyfind(Key, 1, List) of
  359:         R = false ->
  360:             ct:log("Key ~p not found in~n~p", [Key, List]),
  361:             R;
  362:         R -> R
  363:     end.
  364: 
  365: print_interesting_events([], Cnt) ->
  366:     {ok, Cnt};
  367: print_interesting_events([#{level := Level} = Event | Tail], Cnt)
  368:   when Level /= info, Level /= notice ->
  369:     ct:log("------------~nInteresting event found:~n~p~n==========~n", [Event]),
  370:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt + 1);
  371: print_interesting_events([_|Tail], Cnt) ->
  372:     print_interesting_events(Tail, Cnt).
  373: 
  374: verify_events(_TestCase, 0) -> ok;
  375: verify_events(no_sensitive_leak, 1) -> ok;
  376: verify_events(max_channels_option, 3) -> ok;
  377: verify_events(_TestCase, EventNumber) when EventNumber > 0->
  378:     {fail, lists:flatten(
  379:              io_lib:format("unexpected event cnt: ~s",
  380:                            [integer_to_list(EventNumber)]))}.
  381: 
  382: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  383: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  384: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  385: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  386:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  387:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  388: 
  389: simple_exec_more_data(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  390:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  391:     %% more data received, SSH window adjust needs to be sent by client
  392:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 60000).
  393: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  394: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  395:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  396:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  397:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  398:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  399:                                             ]),
  400:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  401: 
  402: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  403: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  404:     Parent = self(),
  405:     F = fun() ->
  406:                 spawn_link(
  407:                   fun() ->
  408:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  409:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  410:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  411:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  412:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  413:                   end)
  414:         end,
  415:     Pid1 = F(),
  416:     Pid2 = F(),
  417:     receive
  418:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  419:     end,
  420:     receive
  421:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  422:     end.
  423: 
  424: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  425: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  426:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  427: 
  428: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  429:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  430: 
  431: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  432:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  433: 
  434: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  435:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  436:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  437: 
  438: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  439:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  440:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  441: 
  442: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  443:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  444:     {error, _Reason} =
  445:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  446: 
  447: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  448:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  449: 
  450:     {error, invalid_port} =
  451:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  452:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  453:                      {user, "foo"},
  454:                      {password, "morot"},
  455:                      {user_interaction, false},
  456:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  457:                     infinity),
  458: 
  459:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  460: 
  461: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  462:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  463: 
  464:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  465:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  466:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  467:                      {user, "foo"},
  468:                      {password, "morot"},
  469:                      {user_interaction, false},
  470:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  471:                    longer),
  472: 
  473:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  474: 
  475: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  476:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  477: 
  478:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  479:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  480:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  481:                      {user, "foo"},
  482:                      {password, "morot"},
  483:                      {user_interaction, false},
  484:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  485:                    -1),
  486: 
  487:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  488: 
  489: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  490:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  491: 
  492:     {error, invalid_options} =
  493:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  494:                     {user, "foo"},
  495:                     infinity),
  496: 
  497:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  498: 
  499: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  500: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  501:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  502: 
  503:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  504:     {error, _} =
  505:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  506:                     {user, "foo"},
  507:                     infinity),
  508: 
  509:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  510: 
  511: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  512:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  513: 
  514:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  515:     {error, _} =
  516:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  517:                     {user, "foo"},
  518:                     short),
  519: 
  520:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  521: 
  522: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  523:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  524: 
  525:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  526:     {error, _} =
  527:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  528:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  529:                     -1),
  530: 
  531:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  532: 
  533: %% All three args incorrect
  534: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  535:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  536: 
  537:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  538:     {error, _} =
  539:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  540:                     {user, "foo"},
  541:                     fortnight),
  542: 
  543:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  544: 
  545: daemon_start(Config) ->
  546:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  547:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  548:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  549:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  550: 
  551:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  552:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  553:                                              {password, "morot"},
  554:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  555:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  556: 
  557: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  558: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  559:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  560:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  561:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  562:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  563:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  564: 
  565: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  566: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  567:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  568:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  569:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  570:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  571:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  572:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  573: 
  574: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  575: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  576:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  577:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  578:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  579: 
  580: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  581: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  582:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  583:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  584:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  585:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  586:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  587: 
  588: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  589: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  590:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  591:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  592:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  593: 
  594: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  595: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  596:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  597:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  598:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  599: 				  "cat", infinity),
  600: 
  601:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  602:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  603:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  604: 
  605:     %% receive response to input
  606:     receive
  607: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  608: 	    ok
  609:     after 
  610: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  611:     end,
  612: 
  613:     %% receive close messages
  614:     receive
  615: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  616: 	    ok
  617:     after 
  618: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  619:     end,
  620:     receive
  621: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  622: 	    ok
  623:     after 
  624: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  625:     end,
  626:     receive
  627: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  628: 	    ok
  629:     after 
  630: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  631:     end.
  632: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  633: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  634:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  635: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  636:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  637:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  638: 				  "cat", infinity),
  639: 
  640:     %% build 10MB binary
  641:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  642: 
  643:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  644:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  645:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  646: 
  647:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  648:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  649: 	{ok, Data} ->
  650: 	    ok;
  651: 	{ok, Other} ->
  652: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  653: 		true ->
  654: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  655: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  656: 		false ->
  657: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  658: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  659: 	    end,
  660: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  661: 	Else ->
  662: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  663:     end,
  664: 
  665:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  666:     receive
  667: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  668: 	    ok 
  669:     after 
  670: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  671:     end,
  672:     receive
  673: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  674: 	    ok
  675:     after 
  676: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  677:     end.
  678: 
  679: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  680: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  681:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  682:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  683:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  684: 
  685:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  686:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  687: 				  "false", infinity),
  688:     receive
  689: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  690: 	    ok
  691:     after 
  692: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  693:     end,
  694:     receive
  695: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  696: 	    ok
  697:     after 
  698: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  699:     end,
  700:     receive
  701: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  702: 	    ok
  703:     after 
  704: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  705:     end,
  706:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  707: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  708: 	ok ->
  709: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  710: 	{error, timeout} ->
  711: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  712: 	Else ->
  713: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  714:     end.
  715: 
  716: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  717: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  718:     Tags =
  719:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  720:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  721:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  722:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  723:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  724:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  725:     Opts =
  726:         lists:zip(Tags,
  727:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  728:     
  729:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  730:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  731:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  732:                 Opts ->
  733:                     ok;
  734:                 Other ->
  735:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  736:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  737:             end;
  738:         Other ->
  739:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  740:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  741:     end.
  742: 
  743: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  744: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  745:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  746:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  747:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  748:                  true -> success;
  749:                  false -> failure
  750:              end,
  751:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  752:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  753: 
  754: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  755: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  756:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  757:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  758:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  759:                  true -> success;
  760:                  false -> failure
  761:              end,
  762:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  763:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  764:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  765: 
  766: 
  767: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  768: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  769:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  770:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  771:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  772:                  true -> success;
  773:                  false -> failure
  774:              end,
  775:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  776:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  777:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  778: 
  779: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  780: %%- small_interrupted_send is interrupted by ssh_echo_server which is
  781: %%  done with transferring data towards client and terminates the
  782: %%  channel (this results with {error, closed} return value from
  783: %%  ssh_connection:send on the client side)
  784: %%- interrupted_send used to be interrupted when ssh_echo_server ran
  785: %%  out of data window and closed channel
  786: %%- but with automatic window adjustment, above condition is not taking
  787: %%  place, so ssh_echo_server continues sending data until it is done
  788: %%- so ssh_connection:send returns 'ok'
  789: small_interrupted_send(Config) ->
  790:     K = 1024,
  791:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  792:     EchoSize = 4 * K,
  793:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, {error, closed}).
  794: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  795:     K = 1024,
  796:     SendSize = 10 * K * K,
  797:     EchoSize = 10 * K * K,
  798:     do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, ok).
  799: 
  800: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize, SenderResult) ->
  801:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  802:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  803:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  804:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  805:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  806:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  807: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  808: 					     {password, "morot"},
  809: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  810:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  811:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  812: 						      {user, "foo"},
  813: 						      {password, "morot"},
  814: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  815: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  816:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  817:     %% build big binary
  818:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  819:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  820:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  821:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  822:     Parent = self(),
  823:     ResultPid = spawn(
  824: 		  fun() ->
  825: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  826: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  827: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  828: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  829: 			      success ->
  830: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  831: 				  Result =
  832: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  833: 				      of
  834: 					  ExpectedData ->
  835: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  836: 					      ok;
  837: 					  Other ->
  838: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  839: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  840: 				      catch
  841: 					  Class:Exception ->
  842: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  843: 				      end,
  844: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  845: 			      Other ->
  846: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  847: 			  end
  848: 		  end),
  849:     receive
  850: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  851: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  852: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  853: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  854: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  855: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  856: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  857: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  858: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  859: 			      end),
  860: 	    receive
  861: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  862: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  863: 		    {fail, Fail};
  864: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  865: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  866: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  867: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  868: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  869: 		    receive
  870: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  871: 			    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect :)",
  872:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  873: 			    ok;
  874: 			Msg ->
  875: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  876: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  877: 		    end;
  878: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
  879: 		    ct:log("~p:~p ~p - That's what we expect, "
  880:                            "but client channel handler has not reported yet",
  881:                            [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
  882: 		    receive
  883: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  884: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  885: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  886: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  887: 			    ok;
  888: 			Msg ->
  889: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  890: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  891: 		    end;
  892: 		Msg ->
  893: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  894: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  895: 	    end
  896:     end.
  897: 
  898: manual_window_handling(Config) ->
  899:     do_adjusted_send(Config, 10, ok).
  900: 
  901: auto_window_handling(Config) ->
  902:     do_adjusted_send(Config, 10, fail).
  903: 
  904: sender_loop(Parent, _ConnRef, _ChannelId, _Bin, 0) ->
  905:     Parent ! {self(), ok};
  906: sender_loop(Parent, ConnRef, ChannelId, Bin, Ctr) ->
  907:     SendBin = <<Ctr:32, Bin/binary>>,
  908:     ct:log("~p:~p Sending packet number ~p", [?MODULE, ?LINE, Ctr]),
  909:     ssh_connection:send(ConnRef, ChannelId, SendBin, 30000),
  910:     sender_loop(Parent, ConnRef, ChannelId, Bin, Ctr - 1).
  911: 
  912: mk_receive_loop_fun(ConnRef, ChannelId, RcvTmo, ReportAdjustFun) ->
  913:     fun(Continue, RcvCtr, 0) ->
  914:         receive
  915:             {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
  916:                 ct:log("~p:~p Received eof", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
  917:                 Continue(Continue, RcvCtr, 0);
  918:             {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {closed, ChannelId}} ->
  919:                 ct:log("~p:~p Peer closed the channel, closing", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
  920:                 ssh:close(ConnRef);
  921:             What ->
  922:                 ct:log("~p:~p What is this ~p?", [?MODULE, ?LINE, What]),
  923:                 Continue(Continue, RcvCtr, 0)
  924:         end;
  925:         (Continue, RcvCtr, ExpectedCtr) ->
  926:             receive
  927:                 {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Ctr:32, _/binary>> = Data}} when byte_size(Data) == 1024 ->
  928:                     ct:log("~p:~p Received back number ~p", [?MODULE, ?LINE, Ctr]),
  929:                     if ExpectedCtr /= Ctr ->
  930:                             ct:fail("Unexpected counter value: ~p (expected ~p)", [Ctr, ExpectedCtr]);
  931:                         true ->
  932:                             Continue(Continue, RcvCtr + 1, ExpectedCtr - 1)
  933:                     end;
  934:                 {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
  935:                     ct:fail("Unexpected eof");
  936:                 {ssh_cm, ConnRef, {closed,ChannelId}} ->
  937:                     ct:fail("Unexpected eof")
  938:             after RcvTmo ->
  939:                 ct:log("~p:~p After ~p packets should adjust window", [?MODULE, ?LINE, RcvCtr]),
  940: 
  941:                 %% This function will either send adjust_window message (if allowed)
  942:                 %% or send a message to the parent PID, which it does not expect
  943:                 %% The latter would mean that the sender sees our recv window as full
  944:                 %% as no auto-adjust happened
  945:                 ReportAdjustFun(),
  946:                 Continue(Continue, RcvCtr, ExpectedCtr)
  947:             end
  948:     end.
  949: 
  950: do_adjusted_send(Config, NPkts, IsAdjustOk) ->
  951:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  952:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  953:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  954:     PktSize = proplists:get_value(init_pkt_size, Config),
  955:     WHM = proplists:get_value(window_handling_mode, Config),
  956:     WinSize = proplists:get_value(init_win_size, Config),
  957:     SendSize = PktSize * NPkts,
  958:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  959:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [SendSize, [{dbg,true}]]},
  960:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  961:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  962: 					     {password, "morot"},
  963: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  964:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  965:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  966: 						      {user, "foo"},
  967: 						      {password, "morot"},
  968: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  969: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  970:     ct:log("~p:~p connected, ref ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE, ConnectionRef]),
  971:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  972:     Parent = self(),
  973:     ResultPid = spawn(
  974: 		  fun() ->
  975: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  976: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, WinSize, PktSize, infinity),
  977: 			  ct:log("~p:~p set window handling mode ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE, WHM]),
  978:                           ssh_connection:set_window_handling_mode(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, WHM),
  979: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  980: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  981: 			      success ->
  982: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  983:                                   ct:log("~p:~p Starting receiver loop", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
  984:                                   AdjTmo = proplists:get_value(adjust_timeout, Config, 0),
  985:                                   ReportAdjustFun =
  986:                                     if IsAdjustOk == ok ->
  987:                                         fun() ->
  988:                                             ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, WinSize)
  989:                                         end;
  990:                                     true ->
  991:                                         fun() -> Parent ! adjust_nok end
  992:                                     end,
  993:                                   LoopFun = mk_receive_loop_fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, AdjTmo, ReportAdjustFun),
  994:                                   Result = LoopFun(LoopFun, 0, NPkts),
  995: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  996: 			      Other ->
  997: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  998: 			  end
  999: 		  end),
 1000:     ct:log("Client channel handler ~p~n", [ResultPid]),
 1001:     receive
 1002: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
 1003: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
 1004: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1005: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1006: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
 1007: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
 1008:             ct:log("~p:~p Starting to send data in 1Kib chunks", [?MODULE, ?LINE]),
 1009:             %% Prepare the binary of (1 KiB - 4 bytes) size
 1010:             %% 4-byte counter is added when sending
 1011:             SendBin = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:duplicate(255, 0)>>,
 1012: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() -> sender_loop(Parent, ConnectionRef, ChannelId, SendBin, 10) end),
 1013:             ct:log("Sender pid ~p~n", [SenderPid]),
 1014:             receive
 1015:                 {ResultPid, result, Result} ->
 1016: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Receiver result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
 1017: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1018: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1019: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1020: 		    receive
 1021: 			{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
 1022: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Sender result:  ~p",
 1023:                                    [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
 1024: 			    ok;
 1025: 			Msg ->
 1026: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Unexpected msg: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1027: 			    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
 1028: 		    end;
 1029: 		{SenderPid, SenderResult} ->
 1030:                     ct:log("~p:~p Sender result:  ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE, SenderResult]),
 1031:                     receive
 1032: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
 1033: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Receiver result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
 1034: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1035: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1036: 			    ok;
 1037: 			Msg ->
 1038: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Unexpected msg: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1039: 			    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
 1040: 		    end;
 1041:                 Msg ->
 1042: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Unexpected msg: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1043: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1044:                     catch exit(ResultPid, terminate),
 1045:                     catch exit(SenderPid, terminate),
 1046: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
 1047:             end
 1048:     end.
 1049: 
 1050: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1051: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1052:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1053:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1054:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1055:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1056:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1057: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1058: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1059: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
 1060: 
 1061:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1062: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1063: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1064: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1065: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1066:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
 1067:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
 1068:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1069:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1070: 
 1071: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1072: new_shell_dumb_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1073:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "dumb",
 1074:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
 1075:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
 1076:                                ],
 1077:                        exp_output =>
 1078:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
 1079:                             <<"1> ">>,
 1080:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
 1081:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
 1082:                             <<"2> ">>],
 1083:                        unexp_output =>
 1084:                            [<<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>]},
 1085:                     Config).
 1086: 
 1087: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1088: new_shell_xterm_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1089:     new_shell_helper(#{term => "xterm",
 1090:                        cmds => ["one_atom_please.\n",
 1091:                                 "\^R" % attempt to trigger history search
 1092:                                ],
 1093:                        exp_output =>
 1094:                            [<<"Enter command\r\n">>,
 1095:                             <<"1> ">>,
 1096:                             <<"one_atom_please.\r\n">>,
 1097:                             <<"{simple_eval,one_atom_please}\r\n">>,
 1098:                             <<"2> ">>,
 1099:                             <<"\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m ">>,
 1100:                             <<"\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\e[J\e[;1;4msearch:\e[0m \r\n  one_atom_please.\e[A\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b\b">>]},
 1101:                     Config).
 1102: 
 1103: new_shell_helper(#{term := Term, cmds := Cmds,
 1104:                    exp_output := ExpectedOutput} = Settings, Config) ->
 1105:     UnexpectedOutput = maps:get(unexp_output, Settings, []),
 1106:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1107:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1108:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1109:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1110:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1111: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1112: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1113:                                              {subsystems, []},
 1114:                                              {keepalive, true},
 1115:                                              {nodelay, true},
 1116:                                              {shell, fun(U, H) ->
 1117:                                                              start_our_shell2(U, H)
 1118:                                                      end}
 1119:                                             ]),
 1120:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1121: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1122: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1123: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1124:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1125:     success =
 1126:         ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1127:                                   [{term, Term}, {hight, 24}, {width,1023}],
 1128:                                   infinity),
 1129:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1130:     [ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, C) || C <- Cmds],
 1131:     GetTuple = fun(Bin) -> {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,0,Bin}} end,
 1132:     Msgs = [GetTuple(B) || B <- ExpectedOutput],
 1133:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(Msgs),
 1134:     UnexpectedMsgs = [GetTuple(C) || C <- UnexpectedOutput],
 1135:     flush_msgs(UnexpectedMsgs),
 1136: 
 1137:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1138:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1139: 
 1140: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------

 1150: 
 1151:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1152: 						      {user, "foo"},

 1269: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
 1270:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
 1271:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1272:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1273:                                           end)
 1274:                             end,
 1275:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1276:                             Config).
 1277: 
 1278: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
 1279:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
 1280:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1281:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1282:                                           end)
 1283:                             end,
 1284:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1285:                             Config).
 1286: 
 1287: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
 1288:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
 1289:                                     spawn(fun() ->
 1290:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1291:                                           end)
 1292:                             end,
 1293:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\r\n">>, 0,
 1294:                             Config).
 1295: 
 1296: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
 1297:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
 1298:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
 1299:                             Config).
 1300: 
 1301: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
 1302:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1303:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1304:                             Config).
 1305: 
 1306: start_shell_exec_direct_fun3(Config) ->
 1307:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
 1308:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
 1309:                             Config).
 1310: 
 1311: start_shell_exec_direct_fun_more_data(Config) ->
 1312:     N = 60000,
 1313:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 1314:     ReceiveFun =
 1315:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, _Expect, _ExpectType) ->
 1316:                 receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId,
 1317:                               N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 1318:         end,
 1319:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct,
 1320:                              fun(_Cmd) ->
 1321:                                      {ok,
 1322:                                       [io_lib:format("testing~n",[]) ||
 1323:                                           _ <- lists:seq(1, N)]}
 1324:                              end},
 1325:                             "not_relevant", <<"not_used\n">>, 0,
 1326:                             ReceiveFun,
 1327:                             Config).
 1328: 
 1329: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
 1330:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
 1331:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
 1332:                             Config).
 1333: 
 1334: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
 1335:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
 1336:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
 1337:                             Config).
 1338: 
 1339: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
 1340:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1341:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1342:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1343:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1344:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1345: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1346: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1347: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1348: 
 1349:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1350:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1351:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1352:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1353:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1354: 
 1355:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1356: 
 1357:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1358:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\r\n">>}}),
 1359: 
 1360:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1361:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1362:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\r\n">>}}),
 1363: 
 1364:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1365:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
 1366:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
 1367:     receive
 1368:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
 1369:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1370:     end,
 1371:     receive
 1372:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1373:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1374:     end,
 1375:     receive
 1376:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1377:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1378:     end,
 1379:     receive
 1380:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1381:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1382:     after 0 -> go_on
 1383:     end,
 1384:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1385: 
 1386: 
 1387: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
 1388:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1389:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1390:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1391:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1392:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1393: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1394: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1395: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1396: 
 1397:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1398:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1399:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1400:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1401:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1402: 
 1403:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1404: 
 1405:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1406:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\r\n">>}}),
 1407: 
 1408:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1409:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1410:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\r\n">>}}),
 1411: 
 1412:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1413:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1414:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1415:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1416:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1417:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\r\n">>}}),
 1418:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1419:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1420:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1421:     receive
 1422:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1423:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1424:     end,
 1425:     receive
 1426:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1427:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1428:     end,
 1429:     receive
 1430:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1431:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1432:     end,
 1433:     receive
 1434:         X -> ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X]),
 1435:         ct:fail("remaining messages")
 1436:     after 0 -> go_on
 1437:     end,
 1438:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1439: 
 1440: 
 1441: 
 1442:     
 1443: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1444: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1445:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1446:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1447: 
 1448: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1449:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1450:         {ok, quit} ->
 1451:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1452:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1453:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1454:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1455:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1456:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1457:     end.
 1458:     
 1459: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1460: 
 1461: 
 1462: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1463:     DefaultReceiveFun =
 1464:         fun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType) ->
 1465:                 receive
 1466:                     {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1467:                         ok
 1468:                 after 5000 ->
 1469:                         receive
 1470:                             Other ->
 1471:                                 ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1472:                                        [Other,
 1473:                                         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 1474:                                          {data, ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1475:                                          %% {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}}]),
 1476:                                 ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1477:                         after 0 ->
 1478:                                 ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1479:                         end
 1480:                 end
 1481:         end,
 1482:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, DefaultReceiveFun, Config).
 1483: 
 1484: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, ReceiveFun, Config) ->
 1485:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1486:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1487:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1488:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1489:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1490: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1491: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1492: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1493: 
 1494:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1495: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1496: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1497: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1498: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1499: 
 1500:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1501:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Command, infinity),
 1502:     ReceiveFun(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Expect, ExpectType),
 1503:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1504:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1505: 
 1506: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1507: %% Issue GH-8223
 1508: trap_exit_connect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1509:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1510:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1511:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1512:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1513:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1514:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1515:                                              {password, "morot"}]),
 1516:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1517:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1518:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1519: 
 1520:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1521:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1522:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1523:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1524:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1525:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1526:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1527:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1528: 
 1529:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1530:     receive
 1531:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1532:     after 0 ->
 1533:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1534:     end.
 1535: 
 1536: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1537: %% Issue GH-8223
 1538: trap_exit_daemon(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1539:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1540:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1541:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1542:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1543: 
 1544:     %% Fake an EXIT message
 1545:     ExitMsg = {'EXIT', self(), make_ref()},
 1546:     self() ! ExitMsg,
 1547: 
 1548:     {ok, DaemonRef} = ssh:daemon(0, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1549:                                      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1550:     ssh:stop_daemon(DaemonRef),
 1551: 
 1552:     %% Ensure the EXIT message is still there
 1553:     receive
 1554:         ExitMsg -> ok
 1555:     after 0 ->
 1556:         ct:fail("No EXIT message")
 1557:     end.

 1559: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1560: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1561:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1562:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1563:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1564:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1565:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1566:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1567:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1568:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1569:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1570: 
 1571:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1572:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1573:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1574: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1575: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1576: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1577: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1578: 
 1579:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1580: 
 1581:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1582: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1583: 
 1584:     receive
 1585: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1586: 	    ok
 1587:     after 5000 ->
 1588: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1589:     end,
 1590: 
 1591:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1592:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1593: 
 1594: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1595: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1596:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1597:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1598:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1599:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1600: 
 1601:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1602:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1603:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1604: 
 1605:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1606:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1607: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1608: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1609: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1610: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1611: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1612: 	       end),
 1613: 
 1614:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1615:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1616:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1617:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1618: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1619: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1620: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1621: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1622: 
 1623:     %% And runs some commands
 1624:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1625: 
 1626:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1627: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1628: 
 1629:     receive
 1630: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1631: 	    ok
 1632:     after 5000 ->
 1633: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1634:     end,
 1635: 
 1636:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1637: 
 1638: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1639: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1640:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1641:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1642:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1643:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1644: 
 1645:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1646: 
 1647:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1648:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1649:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1650: 
 1651:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1652:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1653:                   {password, "morot"},
 1654:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1655: 
 1656:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1657:     Pids =
 1658:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1659:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1660:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1661:                     end)
 1662:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1663:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1664: 
 1665:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1666:     ConnectionRefs =
 1667:         [begin
 1668:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1669:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1670:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1671:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1672:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1673:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1674:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1675:              ConnectionRef
 1676:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1677:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1678: 
 1679:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1680:     Parent = self(),
 1681:     ClientPids =
 1682:         lists:map(
 1683:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1684:                   spawn_link(
 1685:                     fun() ->
 1686:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1687:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1688:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1689:                             receive
 1690:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1691:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1692:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1693:                             after 5000 ->
 1694:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1695:                             end
 1696:                     end)
 1697:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1698:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1699: 
 1700:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1701:                           receive
 1702:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1703:                           end
 1704:                   end, ClientPids),
 1705:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1706: 
 1707:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1708: 
 1709: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1710: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1711:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1712:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1713:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1714:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1715:     
 1716:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1717:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1718:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1719: 
 1720:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1721:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1722:     receive
 1723: 	Verstring ->
 1724: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1725: 	    receive
 1726: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1727: 		    ok
 1728: 	    end
 1729:     after 
 1730: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1731:     end.
 1732:
