 1800: kex_error(Config) ->
 1801:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1802:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1803:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1804:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1805:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1806:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1807:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1808:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1809:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1810:                                              ]),
 1811:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1812:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1813:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1814:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1815:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1816:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1817:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1818:                                    ok % Other msg
 1819:                            end,
 1820:                            self()),
 1821:     try
 1822:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1823:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1824:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1825:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1826:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1827:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1828:                                          ])
 1829:     of
 1830:         _ ->
 1831:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1832:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1833:     catch
 1834:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1835:             %% ok
 1836:             receive
 1837:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1838:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1839:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1840:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1841:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1842:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1843:                                      "Details:",
 1844:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1845:                                      "we have:",
 1846:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1847:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1848:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1849:                     case OK of
 1850:                         true ->
 1851:                             ok;
 1852:                         false ->
 1853:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1854:                     end
 1855:             after 20000 ->
 1856:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1857:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1858:             end;
 1859: 
 1860:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1861:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1862:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1863:     end.
 1864: 
 1865: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1866:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1867:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1868:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1869:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1870:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1871: 
 1872:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1873: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1874: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1875: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1876: 
 1877:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1878:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1879:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1880:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1881:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1882:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1883:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1884:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1885: 
 1886:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1887: 
 1888:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1889:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1890:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1891: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1892: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1893: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1894: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1895:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1896: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1897:     receive
 1898: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1899:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\r\n">>}} ->
 1900: 	    ok
 1901:     after 5000 ->
 1902: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1903:     end,
 1904: 
 1905:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1906:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1907:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1908:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1909: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1910: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1911:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1912:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1913:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1914:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1915:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1916: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1917:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1918:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1919:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1920:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1921:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1922: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1923: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1924: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1925: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1926: 	Error ->
 1927: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1928: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1929: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1930:     end.
 1931: 
 1932: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1933:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1934:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1935:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1936:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1937: 
 1938:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1939:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1940:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1941:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1942:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1943:     Collect = 
 1944:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1945:                 receive
 1946:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1947:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1948:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1949:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1950:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1951:                 after 100 ->
 1952:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1953:                 end
 1954:         end,
 1955:  
 1956:     %% Install the test handler:
 1957:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1958:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1959:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1960:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1961:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1962:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1963:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1964:                                    ok
 1965:                            end,
 1966:                            self()),
 1967: 
 1968:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1969: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1970: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1971: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1972: 
 1973:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1974: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1975: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1976: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1977: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1978:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1979:     [true|_] =
 1980:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1981:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1982:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1983:     
 1984:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1985:     timer:sleep(500),
 1986:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1987:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1988: 
 1989:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1990:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1991:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1992:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1993:     end.
 1994:     
 1995: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1996:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1997:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1998:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1999:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2000:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 2001: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 2002: 					     {password, "morot"},
 2003: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 2004: 
 2005:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 2006: 						      {user, "foo"},
 2007: 						      {password, "morot"},
 2008: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 2009: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 2010: 
 2011: 
 2012:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2013:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 2014:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 2015:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 2016:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 2017:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 2018: 
 2019:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 2020:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2021:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 2022:     timer:sleep(2000),
 2023:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 2024:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 2025:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 2026:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 2027: 
 2028:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 2029:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 2030: 
 2031: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2032: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2033:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2034:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 2035:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 2036:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2037:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 2038: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 2039: 					     {password, "morot"},
 2040: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 2041: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 2042: 					    ]),
 2043: 
 2044:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 2045: 						      {user, "foo"},
 2046: 						      {password, "morot"},
 2047: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 2048: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 2049: 
 2050:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 2051:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 2052:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2053:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2054:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2055:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2056:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2057:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2058:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2059:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2060: 
 2061:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 2062:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 2063: 
 2064:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 2065:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 2066:     receive
 2067: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 2068: 	    ok
 2069:     after 5000 ->
 2070: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 2071:     end,
 2072: 
 2073:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 2074:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 2075: 
 2076:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 2077:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 2078:     receive
 2079: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 2080: 	    ok
 2081:     after 5000 ->
 2082: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 2083:     end,
 2084: 
 2085:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 2086:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 2087: 
 2088:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 2089:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 2090: 
 2091:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 2092:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 2093:     
 2094:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 2095:     receive
 2096: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 2097:     after 5000 ->
 2098: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 2099: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 2100: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 2101: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 2102:     end,
 2103: 
 2104:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 2105:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 2106: 
 2107:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 2108:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 2109: 
 2110:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 2111:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 2112: 
 2113: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2114: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 2115: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2116: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 2117:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, 1).
 2118: 
 2119: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef, N) ->
 2120:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2121:     Cmd = "yes testing | head -n " ++ integer_to_list(N),
 2122:     ct:log("Cmd to be invoked over SSH shell: ~p", [Cmd]),
 2123:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Cmd, infinity),
 2124:     ExpectedBin = <<"testing\n">>,
 2125:     case N of
 2126:         1 ->
 2127:             %% receive response to input
 2128:             receive
 2129:                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, ExpectedBin}} ->
 2130:                     ok
 2131:             after
 2132:                 10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2133:             end;
 2134:         _ ->
 2135:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, N * byte_size(ExpectedBin), 0)
 2136:     end,
 2137: 
 2138:     %% receive close messages
 2139:     receive
 2140: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 2141: 	    ok
 2142:     after
 2143: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2144:     end,
 2145:     receive
 2146: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 2147: 	    ok
 2148:     after
 2149: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2150:     end,
 2151:     receive
 2152: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 2153: 	    ok
 2154:     after
 2155: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2156:     end.
 2157: 
 2158: 
 2159: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2160: flush_msgs() ->
 2161:     flush_msgs([]).
 2162: 
 2163: flush_msgs(Unexpected) ->
 2164:     receive
 2165:         M ->
 2166:             case lists:member(M, Unexpected) of
 2167:                 true ->
 2168:                     ct:fail("Unexpected message found:  ~p", [M]);
 2169:                 _ ->
 2170:                     flush_msgs()
 2171:             end
 2172:     after
 2173:         500 -> ok
 2174:     end.
 2175: 
 2176: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2177: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2178:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 2179: 
 2180: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 2181:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2182:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 2183:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2184:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 2185:     receive
 2186:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2187:             flush_msgs();
 2188: 
 2189:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2190:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 2191: 
 2192:         R ->
 2193:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2194:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 2195:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2196: 
 2197:     after 5000 ->
 2198:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 2199:     end.
 2200: 
 2201: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2202: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2203:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2204:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 2205:     receive
 2206:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 2207:             flush_msgs();
 2208:         R ->
 2209:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2210:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 2211:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 2212:     after 5000 ->
 2213:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 2214:     end.
 2215: 
 2216: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2217: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2218:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 2219: 
 2220: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 2221:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 2222: 
 2223: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 2224:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2225:     case PtyOpts of
 2226:         [] ->
 2227:             no_alloc;
 2228:         _ ->
 2229:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 2230:     end,
 2231:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 2232: 
 2233:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2234:     receive
 2235: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 2236: 	    flush_msgs();
 2237: 
 2238:         R ->
 2239:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2240:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 2241:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 2242: 
 2243:     after 5000 ->
 2244: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 2245:     end.
 2246: 
 2247: 
 2248: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 2249:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 2250: 
 2251: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 2252:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 2253:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 2254:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 2255:     receive
 2256:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0,
 2257:                                  <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 2258:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 2259:         Other ->
 2260:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 2261:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,
 2262:                                            {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}}]),
 2263:             {fail, "Unexpected data"}
 2264:     after 5000 ->
 2265:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 2266:     end.
 2267: 
 2268: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 2269: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 2270:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 2271: 
 2272: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 2273:     receive
 2274: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 2275: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 2276: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2277: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 2278:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 2279: 	    timeout
 2280:     end.
 2281: 
 2282: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 2283:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",
 2284:            [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 2285:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 2286: 
 2287: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 2288:     TO = 5000,
 2289:     receive
 2290: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 2291: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2292: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 2293: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 2294: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 2295: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2296: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 2297: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 2298: 	Msg ->
 2299: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 2300: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2301:     after TO ->
 2302: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 2303: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 2304:     end.
 2305: 
 2306: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 2307:     try
 2308: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 2309:     of
 2310: 	Bin ->
 2311: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 2312: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 2313: 	    Bin
 2314:     catch
 2315: 	C:E ->
 2316: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 2317: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 2318: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 2319:     end.
 2320: 
 2321: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 2322: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 2323: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 2324:     spawn(fun() ->
 2325: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 2326: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 2327:           end).
 2328: 
 2329: start_our_shell2(_User, _Peer) ->
 2330:     spawn(fun() ->
 2331:                   io:format("Enter command\n"),
 2332:                   read_write_loop1("> ", 1)
 2333:           end).
 2334: 
 2335: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 2336:     spawn(fun() ->
 2337:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 2338:           end).
 2339: 
 2340: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 2341:     spawn(fun() ->
 2342:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 2343:           end).
 2344: 
 2345: receive_bytes(_, _, 0, _) ->
 2346:     ct:log("ALL DATA RECEIVED Budget = 0"),
 2347:     ct:log("================================ ExpectBudget = 0 (reception completed)"),
 2348:     ok;
 2349: receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Budget, AccSize) when Budget > 0 ->
 2350:     receive
 2351:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, D}} ->
 2352:             Fmt = "================================ ExpectBudget = "
 2353:                 "~p bytes Received/Total = ~p/~p bytes",
 2354:             Args = [Budget, byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D)],
 2355:             ct:log(Fmt, Args),
 2356:             receive_bytes(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 2357:                           Budget - byte_size(D), AccSize + byte_size(D))
 2358:     after
 2359:         10000 ->
 2360:             ct:log("process_info(self(), messages) = ~p",
 2361:                    [process_info(self(), messages)]),
 2362:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2363:     end.
